00023 #ifndef __BMESH_ITERATORS_H__
00024 #define __BMESH_ITERATORS_H__
00025 
00042 #include "BLI_mempool.h"
00043 
00044 /* Defines for passing to BM_iter_new.
00045  *
00046  * "OF" can be substituted for "around"
00047  * so BM_VERTS_OF_FACE means "vertices
00048  * around a face."
00049  */
00050 
00051 /* these iterator over all elements of a specific
00052  * type in the mesh.
00053  *
00054  * be sure to keep 'bm_iter_itype_htype_map' in sync with any changes
00055  */
00056 typedef enum BMIterType {
00057     BM_VERTS_OF_MESH = 1,
00058     BM_EDGES_OF_MESH = 2,
00059     BM_FACES_OF_MESH = 3,
00060     /* these are topological iterators. */
00061     BM_EDGES_OF_VERT = 4,
00062     BM_FACES_OF_VERT = 5,
00063     BM_LOOPS_OF_VERT = 6,
00064     BM_VERTS_OF_EDGE = 7, /* just v1, v2: added so py can use generalized sequencer wrapper */
00065     BM_FACES_OF_EDGE = 8,
00066     BM_VERTS_OF_FACE = 9,
00067     BM_EDGES_OF_FACE = 10,
00068     BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE = 11,
00069     /* returns elements from all boundaries, and returns
00070      * the first element at the end to flag that we're entering
00071      * a different face hole boundary*/
00072     BM_ALL_LOOPS_OF_FACE = 12,
00073     /* iterate through loops around this loop, which are fetched
00074      * from the other faces in the radial cycle surrounding the
00075      * input loop's edge.*/
00076     BM_LOOPS_OF_LOOP = 13,
00077     BM_LOOPS_OF_EDGE = 14
00078 } BMIterType;
00079 
00080 #define BM_ITYPE_MAX 15
00081 
00082 /* the iterator htype for each iterator */
00083 extern const char bm_iter_itype_htype_map[BM_ITYPE_MAX];
00084 
00085 #define BM_ITER_MESH(ele, iter, bm, itype) \
00086     for (ele = BM_iter_new(iter, bm, itype, NULL); ele; ele = BM_iter_step(iter))
00087 
00088 #define BM_ITER_MESH_INDEX(ele, iter, bm, itype, indexvar) \
00089     for (ele = BM_iter_new(iter, bm, itype, NULL), indexvar = 0; ele; ele = BM_iter_step(iter), (indexvar)++)
00090 
00091 #define BM_ITER_ELEM(ele, iter, data, itype) \
00092     for (ele = BM_iter_new(iter, NULL, itype, data); ele; ele = BM_iter_step(iter))
00093 
00094 #define BM_ITER_ELEM_INDEX(ele, iter, data, itype, indexvar) \
00095     for (ele = BM_iter_new(iter, NULL, itype, data), indexvar = 0; ele; ele = BM_iter_step(iter), (indexvar)++)
00096 
00097 /* Iterator Structure */
00098 typedef struct BMIter {
00099     BLI_mempool_iter pooliter;
00100 
00101     BMVert *firstvert, *nextvert, *vdata;
00102     BMEdge *firstedge, *nextedge, *edata;
00103     BMLoop *firstloop, *nextloop, *ldata, *l;
00104     BMFace *firstpoly, *nextpoly, *pdata;
00105     BMesh *bm;
00106     void (*begin)(struct BMIter *iter);
00107     void *(*step)(struct BMIter *iter);
00108     union {
00109         void       *p;
00110         int         i;
00111         long        l;
00112         float       f;
00113     } filter;
00114     int count;
00115     char itype;
00116 } BMIter;
00117 
00118 void *BM_iter_at_index(BMesh *bm, const char itype, void *data, int index);
00119 int   BM_iter_as_array(BMesh *bm, const char itype, void *data, void **array, const int len);

00143 void *bmiter__vert_of_face_step(struct BMIter *iter);
00144 void  bmiter__edge_of_face_begin(struct BMIter *iter);

00147 void *bmiter__loop_of_face_step(struct BMIter *iter);
